doc_desc.title: CES-D (Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale)

title_statement.title: CES-D: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale
title_statement.subtitle: A 20-item self-report measure of depressive symptoms in the general population

study_info.abstract: The CES-D is a 20-item self-report depression scale designed to measure depressive symptoms in the general population. It is widely used in epidemiological studies and clinical research. The scale assesses frequency and duration of depressive symptoms over the past week on a 4-point Likert scale.

instrument_details.full_name: Center for Epidemiologic Studies Depression Scale
instrument_details.interpretation: 0-15: No/minimal depression; 16-26: Mild depression; 27-32: Moderate depression; 33+: Severe depression

psychometric_properties.validity: High convergent validity with clinical diagnoses

questions.question_text: I was bothered by things that usually don't bother me
response_options: Rarely or none of the time (less than 1 day)
Some or a little of the time (1-2 days)
Occasionally or a moderate amount of the time (3-4 days)
Most or all of the time (5-7 days)
